MCQ: Who coined the term 'machine learning' in 1959?
Choices: a: Arthur Samuel | b: Raytheon Company | C: Donald Hebb | d: Warren McCulloch

MCQ: Which book introduced a theoretical neural structure by Canadian psychologist Donald Hebb in 1949?
Choices: a: The Organization of Behavior | b: Learning Machines | C: Computing Machinery and Intelligence | d: The Art of Computer Programming

MCQ: Which of the following was an experimental 'learning machine' developed by Raytheon Company in the early 1960s?
Choices: a: Cybertron | b: Samuel Checkers-Playing Program | C: Perceptron | d: ECHO

MCQ: What does Tom M. Mitchell's definition of machine learning describe as the main aspect of performance improvement?
Choices: a: Improvement in hardware | b: Improvement in speed | C: Improvement in performance with experience | d: Improvement in memory

MCQ: What are the two main objectives of modern-day machine learning?
Choices: a: To classify data and to make predictions | b: To improve hardware and to make predictions | C: To classify data and to improve speed | d: To improve hardware and to classify data
